item.title: Welding repair on a cracked excavator cylinder
item.description: A step-by-step process repairing a cracked hydraulic cylinder on an excavator, focusing on weld quality and durability. How can proper welding restore critical components?

media:content.media:title: Welding repair on a cracked excavator cylinder
media:content.media:description: A step-by-step process repairing a cracked hydraulic cylinder on an excavator, focusing on weld quality and durability. How can proper welding restore critical components?

item.title: Repairing a CAT 12M motor grader cylinder
item.description: A step-by-step look at restoring the hydraulic cylinder on a CAT 12M motor grader, focusing on inspection, repair, and ensuring reliable performance. What’s key to a successful cylinder rebuild?

item.title: Maximizing potential with machining and milling
item.description: Exploring the combined use of machining, welding, and milling to enhance equipment performance and precision. What techniques bring out the best in heavy machinery?

item.title: John Deere grader blade in need of repair
item.description: A heavily worn John Deere grader blade is inspected and prepped for refurbishment, highlighting the importance of maintenance and precision. How does wear affect performance?

item.title: Creating custom workshop storage solutions
item.description: A look at designing and building storage tailored for workshop efficiency, organization, and easy access to tools. How can smart storage improve workflow and productivity?

item.title: Kurtis tackles the Franna winch project
item.description: A detailed look at Kurtis navigating challenges while working on a Franna crane winch, highlighting problem-solving, precision, and hands-on engineering. How do skilled machinists overcome tough mechanical projects?

item.title: Adapter plate finished and ready for use
item.description: A completed adapter plate is machined, checked, and prepared for installation, highlighting precision and fit in workshop engineering. What final checks matter most before assembly?

item.title: Machining an adapter plate for a transmission dyno
item.description: Follow the process of making a custom adapter plate for a transmission dynamometer, focusing on accurate machining, fitment, and workshop techniques. What tolerances matter most in dyno setups?

item.title: Restoring a D8 dozer mouthpiece
item.description: Follow the process of restoring a D8 dozer’s mouthpiece, highlighting cleaning, repair, and preparation for heavy-duty use. How does proper maintenance extend equipment life?

item.title: Machining hydraulic cylinder rods and barrels
item.description: This video shows the precision machining of hydraulic cylinder rods and barrels, focusing on accuracy, surface finish, and workshop techniques. How does machining quality affect performance?

item.title: Cylinder eye completely disassembled
item.description: The eye of a hydraulic cylinder is fully torn down for inspection and repair, revealing critical wear points and restoration methods. What can teardown reveal that visual checks cannot?

item.title: Drilling and tapping a 2-metre bar
item.description: With a vintage milling and drilling attachment mounted, multiple holes are drilled, reamed, and tapped to fit 12mm tooling. How does precision setup affect final results?

item.title: Upgrading workshop storage
item.description: See how a workshop storage upgrade improves organization, efficiency, and workflow for machining and engineering projects. How can storage changes boost productivity?

item.title: New year, better workshop setup
item.description: A look at workshop improvements to start the year more organized and efficient, including tools, layout, and workspaces. What small changes make the biggest impact?

item.title: Repairing hydraulic cylinder barrels
item.description: Follow along as hydraulic cylinder barrels are inspected, repaired, and restored for reliable performance in demanding applications. What steps are most critical for a lasting repair?

item.title: 150-tonne hydraulic jacking cylinder rebuild
item.description: A full rebuild of a massive 150-tonne hydraulic jacking cylinder, showing disassembly, inspection, and restoration steps. What’s involved in restoring such large machinery?

item.title: Heavy-duty tool post grinder in action
item.description: See a heavy-duty tool post grinder at work, tackling multiple tasks and demonstrating efficiency and versatility in machining. What challenges does this machine handle best?

item.title: Internal damage in a hydraulic cylinder
item.description: A closer look at a cylinder that was being damaged from the inside, with inspection and repair techniques explained. What signs indicate internal wear early?

item.title: Exploring our SIP jig borer tooling
item.description: A detailed look at a SIP jig borer tooling collection, highlighting various tools, their functions, and applications in machining. How do these tools improve precision work?

item.title: Oxy gas cutting a D11 ripper shank
item.description: Watch a broken D11 ripper shank being carefully cut using oxy gas and a beetle torch, highlighting safe techniques in heavy equipment repair. How does precision cutting help in tough repairs?
